item.title: Hash House Harriers trails 2021
item.description:
The London Hash House Harriers (LH3) run weekly all over London. Using GPS data from Strava, I have created a map (below) showing the routes run so far this year.

Due to Covid-19 lockdown restrictions, we were only able to begin running again in April, and even these runs were socially distanced (no running the trail in a big group, no pub at the end). As restrictions are eased we hope to get back to the traditional hashing format soon.

Full page version of map

CH3astEnders

Ever since the first lockdown in 2020, City Hash has been running in local pods in order to comply is lockdown restrictions. I have spent the majority of my time running with the east-end group known as CH3astEnders (or City Eels). Each week, our trails took us over

Full page version of map

item.title: Hash trails 2020
item.description:
Several Hash House Harrier groups run all over London each week. Each week the location of the trails varies as that week’s “hare” lays the trail in an area they know well. I have been collecting the GPS routes of the trails from Strava for each group and plotting them on a map using Python.

If you are interested in running/drinking with one of the Hashes, check our when and where upcoming hash trails will be on the London Hash House Harriers site or the London Hashing Site (LaSH).

Most recent trails

The map below shows the trails run over the last week (or so) by the various Hash House Harrier groups around London. You can zoom in on the map, and click on the location icon to get details of which group each trail belongs to.

Full page version of map
